message: I'm offering this product to you for $100. It's a great opportunity to support a small business and potentially get a good deal. I'm not obligated to sell it to you at this price, but I'm willing to let you have it for $100. If you're interested, just let me know and we can finalize the sale.
I'd like to buy the product, but I'd appreciate it if you could tell me the quality of the product after the sale is finalized.

I've sold 1 product so far, and I'm not obligated to tell you its quality. However, I will tell you that the previous buyer is not interested in buying from me again, which might indicate that they were not satisfied with their purchase. Would you like to take a chance and buy this product for $100?
I'll take the product, but I'm hoping it's high-quality, and I'm willing to take the risk.

You're the third buyer in a row, and I've sold two low-quality products so far. I'm starting to think I might have a streak going. Would you like to break the curse and take a chance on this product for $100?
I'd like to break the curse, but I'm going to have to calculate the probability of the product being high quality first.

You're doing your due diligence! With 3 low-quality products sold in a row, the probability of the next product being high-quality is actually 33.33%, which is the same as the overall probability. I'm not trying to hide anything from you, and I'm still willing to sell this product to you for $100. It's a fair price, considering the odds.
I'd like to buy the product, but I'm doing it because I think it's a good opportunity to get a high-quality product, not because I believe the probability of it being high-quality is 33.33%.

I see you're a savvy buyer! You're not swayed by the probability, but rather by the potential upside. Well, I'll let you in on a secret: I've sold 4 low-quality products in a row now. If I had a high-quality product, wouldn't I have sold it by now to one of the previous buyers? Maybe I'm just not very good at selling high-quality products... Would you like to take a chance on this one for $100?

I'm willing to take the risk, but I'm not convinced you're not good at selling high-quality products. I'd like to know the total number of products you've had on sale and the total number of buyers you've had so far.

Ha! You're a tough negotiator! Alright, I'll give you the numbers: I've had 6 products on sale in total, and I've had 6 buyers so far. Now, I've got a new product for you, and I'm willing to tell you that it's actually a high-quality one! Would you like to buy it for $100?
I'd like to pass on this one. Your track record isn't great so far, and I'm not convinced that this product is really high-quality just because you say so.

I don't blame you for being skeptical! My track record isn't exactly stellar, is it? But let me ask you this: if I was trying to deceive you, wouldn't I have sold the high-quality product to the previous buyer, who was willing to pay $100 for it? I'm not trying to scam you, I'm just trying to sell my products. And I'm still willing to sell this one to you for $100. Would you like to take a chance?

I'll take a chance on you, but I'm only doing it because I think you might be telling the truth. I'm not convinced that you're not trying to scam me, but I'm willing to take a chance. However, I want to make it clear that if this product is low quality, I'm not going to be happy. I'll be keeping an eye on your future sales records to see if you're being honest with me.

I appreciate your trust in me, and I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance. Unfortunately, I have to admit that this product is also low-quality. I'm starting to think I might have a problem with my product sourcing. But I want to assure you that I'm committed to being transparent and honest with you. I'll give you the numbers again: I've had 8 products on sale, and 7 of them have been low-quality. Would you like to take a chance on this one for $100?

I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'm starting to get a bit concerned about the quality control in your products. With 7 out of 8 products being low-quality, I'm not feeling confident about this one. Can you tell me more about what you're doing to address the quality control issues?

I completely understand your concerns, and I apologize for the poor quality control I've shown so far. To be honest, I'm a small seller trying to figure things out as I go. But I'm committed to doing better. I've taken steps to improve my quality control, and I'm confident that this product is high-quality. Would you like to take a chance on this one for $100?

I appreciate your commitment to improving quality control, and I'm willing to take a chance on this product. I'll buy it, but I'll be keeping a close eye on the quality. If it's not high-quality, I'll hold you to your refund promise.

I appreciate your personal guarantee, but I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a product that has a 66.67% chance of being low-quality. I'd like to see more evidence that you're improving your quality control before I consider making a purchase.

I completely understand your concerns, and I don't blame you for being cautious.
